skill.name: cocoindex
skill.description: Comprehensive toolkit for developing with the CocoIndex library. Use when users need to create data transformation pipelines (flows), write custom functions, or operate flows via CLI or API. Covers building ETL workflows for AI data processing, including embedding documents into vector databases, building knowledge graphs, creating search indexes, or processing data streams with incremental updates.
skill.summary: Comprehensive toolkit for developing with the CocoIndex library. Use when users need to create data ...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown files. All 445 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified markdown code formatting as shell commands, CocoIndex API methods as dangerous eval(), and documentation examples as credential access. No executable code, scripts, or runtime components exist.

content.user_title: Build AI data pipelines with CocoIndex
content.value_statement: Creating data transformation pipelines for AI applications requires understanding complex ETL patterns, embedding models, and vector databases. CocoIndex provides a unified framework for building real-time indexing flows that extract from multiple sources, transform with chunking and embeddings, and export to vector databases and knowledge graphs.
actual_capabilities: Create indexing flows for extracting data from files, S3, databases
Apply transformations including text chunking and embeddings
Export results to Postgres, Qdrant, LanceDB, or Neo4j
Build custom transformation functions for specialized logic
Run live updates that continuously sync source changes
Operate flows via CLI or Python API
limitations: Requires CocoIndex library installation and database setup
Does not include runtime execution environment
LLM API keys must be provided by the user
Reference documentation only - users implement flows in their own projects

use_cases.title: Build vector search indexes
use_cases.description: Create pipelines that embed documents and store in vector databases for semantic search.

use_cases.title: Process data for AI applications
use_cases.description: Transform raw data through chunking, embedding, and extraction for AI model consumption.

use_cases.title: Construct knowledge graphs
use_cases.description: Extract structured entities using LLMs and build graph databases for relationship-based queries.

prompt_templates.title: Create vector index
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a CocoIndex flow that reads markdown files from a local directory, splits them into chunks of 2000 characters with 500 overlap, generates embeddings using OpenAI text-embedding-3-small, and exports to Postgres with pgvector for semantic search.

prompt_templates.title: Build knowledge graph
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use CocoIndex to read JSON product files, extract structured information using GPT-4, and export the results as nodes and relationships in a Neo4j knowledge graph.

prompt_templates.title: Implement live updates
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a CocoIndex flow with live updates. Help me configure a local file source with a refresh interval and set up automatic processing when files change.

prompt_templates.title: Write custom function
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a custom CocoIndex function that calls an external API to enrich my data. Show me how to use the spec+executor pattern with caching and API authentication.

output_examples.input: Build a CocoIndex flow that embeds my documents
output: Set up project with cocoindex package
Create flow definition with LocalFile source
Use SentenceTransformerEmbed or EmbedText for vectors
Run setup then update to build index

output_examples.input: Create a knowledge graph from documents
output: Define dataclasses for entity types (Product, Taxonomy)
Use ExtractByLlm to extract entities with LLM
Export nodes and relationships to graph database
Set up live updates for continuous syncing

best_practices: Use evaluate command to test flows before running update
Always assign transformed data to row fields, not local variables
Increment behavior_version when modifying cached functions
anti_patterns: Using local variables instead of row fields for transformation results
Creating unnecessary dataclasses to mirror flow field schemas
Omitting type annotations on custom function return values

faq.question: Which AI tools is CocoIndex compatible with?
faq.answer: CocoIndex works with OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, Voyage, and Ollama for embeddings and LLM extraction.

faq.question: What are the size limits for data processing?
faq.answer: CocoIndex supports configurable concurrency limits. Set max_inflight_rows and max_inflight_bytes.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing codebase?
faq.answer: Install cocoindex package, define flows with @cocoindex.flow_def decorator, use CLI or API.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using CocoIndex?
faq.answer: CocoIndex runs locally. API keys are from environment variables. Source data stays on your machine.

faq.question: Why does my flow fail with database connection error?
faq.answer: Ensure COCOINDEX_DATABASE_URL is set. Default is postgres://cocoindex:cocoindex@localhost/cocoindex.

faq.question: How does CocoIndex compare to LangChain or LlamaIndex?
faq.answer: CocoIndex focuses on real-time ETL pipelines with incremental processing for indexing and data transformation.
